title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, celebrating 20 years since his debut album 'Get Lifted'.
The setlist included songs from 'Get Lifted', covers, and a medley featuring hits from Lauryn Hill and Kanye West.
Legend showcased his musical versatility, blending gospel, R&B, and pop in a performance lasting over two hours.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, implying bias in the fourth quarter.
Brown refrained from further comments on officiating, despite claiming Magic players physically impeded him during the game.
A league report confirmed a missed foul in Celtics' earlier 105-103 loss to the Jazz, with no fine issued to Brown.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield is an MVP candidate with 1,919 yards, 13 touchdowns, and a 98.1 passer rating.
Rookie Emeka Egbuka has 562 receiving yards, 5 touchdowns, but has struggled against man coverage this season.
Buccaneers' defense ranks seventh in defensive DVOA with standouts like Vita Vea and Jamel Dean contributing significantly.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game Sunday, their first since Week 6 of 2023.
CBS's top announcer team selection marks Patriots' renewed relevance, led by quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel.
Nantz's schedule change from Bills-Dolphins highlights Patriots' improved performance; Maye and Nantz share a personal connection.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Orlando Magic defeated the Boston Celtics 123-110, marking Boston's first loss in the NBA Cup.
Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 32 points, but struggled from three-point range, shooting 1-for-6.
The Magic outshot the Celtics from deep, making 17 of 36 three-pointers, while Boston's centers and defense faltered.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand for creating an appearance of impropriety in an ICE-related case.
A state hearing officer found Judge Joseph unaware of the escape plan, lacking evidence she authorized the defendant's ICE evasion.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022; she faces public reprimand to clarify her role in the 2018 incident.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox's season ended after losing to the Yankees in the AL Wild Card Series, winning only one game.
Manager Alex Cora expressed optimism, noting the team took a step forward despite needing further improvements.
Offseason changes include Trevor Story opting in, Alex Bregman opting out, and potential outfield trades.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A wind turbine blade detached and fell into a cranberry bog near Head of the Bay Road in Plymouth.
The detached blade, measuring 75 to 100 feet, was found several hundred feet from the turbine’s base.
No injuries occurred and the turbine automatically shut down; the incident is under investigation by local officials.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' is a new Marvel film streaming on Disney+ and marks the start of MCU Phase 6.
'Frankenstein' directed by Guillermo del Toro, a new adaptation of Mary Shelley's novel, is available on Netflix.
'Death by Lightning', a limited series on Netflix, explores the story of President James A. Garfield's assassination.

title: Stefon Diggs reveals what he’s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs focuses on improving his attitude, seeking excellence and aiming for perfection as a competitive edge.
Diggs leads Patriots with 508 receiving yards, 45 receptions, and 25 first down receptions through nine games.
Diggs credits coaches Josh McDaniels and Todd Downing for fostering growth in Patriots' offensive environment.
